metadata.Title: CVE-2017-15056 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.Description:
p_lx_elf.cpp in UPX 3.94 mishandles ELF headers, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted binary file, as demonstrated by an Invalid Pointer Read in PackLinuxElf64::unpack().

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-15056` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

upx-ucl - 3.94-4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: upx-ucl package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.94-4').
